content.description: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is defined by the equation <math alttext="the fraction with numerator x cubed, and denominator 3, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator y squared, and denominator 2, end fraction, minus 3 x, plus 2 y, equals, negative one sixth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements are true?
content.question: At points where <math alttext="x equals, the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the lines tangent to the curve are horizontal.At points where <math alttext="y equals, negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the lines tangent to the curve are vertical.The line tangent to the curve at the point <math alttext="with coordinates 1 comma 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> has slope <math alttext="two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
